intro: Chenopodium ccuchi-huila, commonly known as the Andean goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are often used in local traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Chenopodium ccuchi-huila plays a role in the ecological balance of its environment, supporting local biodiversity.
